directions: Cook the brown rice according to package instructions.
Cut the chicken breast into bite-sized pieces.
Chop the broccoli, bell peppers, onion, garlic, and ginger.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Add the garlic, ginger, onion, and bell peppers, and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add the broccoli and cook until slightly tender, about 3 minutes.
Pour in the soy sauce and stir to combine.
Serve the stir-fry over the cooked rice.
Cook the brown rice according to package instructions.
Cut chicken breast into bite-sized pieces. Season with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides.
Add chopped onion, garlic, and ginger to the skillet and cook for 1 minute, stirring frequently.
Add chopped bell pepper and broccoli to the skillet and cook for 5 minutes, or until tender-crisp.
Pour soy sauce over the chicken and vegetables and stir to coat.
Serve the stir-fry over cooked brown rice.
Enjoy!
Cook brown rice according to package instructions.
Cut chicken breast into bite-sized pieces.
Slice red bell pepper and onion.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Add onion and garlic, cook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
Add broccoli florets and red bell pepper, cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with soy sauce, ginger, and black pepper.
Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Serve chicken stir-fry over brown rice.
In a large mug, combine oat flour, whey protein powder, baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
Crack in the eggs and whisk until well combined.
Add milk, honey, and peanut butter, whisking until smooth.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Microwave on high for 60-90 seconds, or until the cake is cooked through and slightly puffed.
Let cool for a few minutes before enjoying.
